title: Mourning Sampler, 1810
medium:
Medium: silk  
Technique: embroidered and painted on plain weave
inscribed: "Sacred to the memory of Dr. Robt Rogerson. obt. April 1st 1806, AE 49 y's. Lucy Rogerson. obt. March 4th, 1807, AE 39. Danl. H. Rogerson. obt., March 25th, 1808, AE 14. Lucy H. Rogerson. obt. 1803, AE 11 months."
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. Purchased at Drake sale, cat #794, 1913.
creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
description: Mourning female figure leaning on a tomb surmounted by an urn under the shade of a weeping willow. Embroidered in tan silk with toned watercolor washes. Trial sketch of head on left margin and trial letters in lower right and bottom margins.

tombstone.epitaph:
Mourning Sampler, 1810.
1810. Medium: silk  
Technique: embroidered and painted on plain weave. Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection. 1974-100-30.
